intro: Gifolaria floribunda, commonly known as the golden bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its showy, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows as an herbaceous perennial, reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are lanceolate and slightly hairy, while the flowers bloom in clusters at the ends of the stems. Gifolaria floribunda is valued for its ornamental appeal and is often cultivated in gardens for its vibrant blooms.
